How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:An electronics store had things damaged from the rain, where should these things be stored? Choices:  A: large city B: strip mall C: building D: shopping mall E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		Choice: A<n><n>### Justification:<n><n>### Instructions:Use the diagram to answer the question.<n>Input:<n>|    5 |    10 |<n>|---   |---   |<n>|    6 |  13   |<n>|    7 |   8  |<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:<n>| 12 |<n>|--- |<n>| --- |<n>|--- | --- |<n><n><n><n><n>### Instracion:<n>Use each part of the diagram to answer the questions that follow.<n><n>### Justificatiom:<n><n>Input:<n>|  50 |<n>|---  |<n>|---- |<n>| --  |<n><n>### Demontration:<n>Input :<n>| 20 |<n>| ---  |<n>| ---   |<n><n>### Instraction:<n><n>Input: 1. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:What could be happening near you if the ground is getting wet? Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input A: The number of blue balls can be found in the solution for question 10. So, the number of balls should be 11.<n><n>### Response A: The number of green balls must be 1/3 the sum of the total for the solutions to question 5 and 6.<n><n>### Input B: The sum of the solutions to question 1 and 5 is 18<n><n>### Response B: So, if Mara has ¾ as many cards as Jan, then 211 must be the answer to this question.<n>

It is also known that 20% of students do not order anything.<n>* 75% of students who order french fries also order a drink.<n>* 80% of students who order a hotdog also order a drink. If 420 students in the cafeteria order a hotdog, then 192 additional students must also order a hotdog. How many students order french fry?<n><n>### Explanation:<n>* 50% of students order french fies.<n>* The sum of 50% and 25% is equal to 75%<n>* Of the students that order french fries 80% also order a drink. So the number of students that order drinks is more than 80% of 75% <n>* From this we know that 64 of the students that order fries also order a

Choices:  A: mouth B: can C: human D: snake E: kentucky fried chicken<n><n>### Response:		B: can <n><n>### Instructions:A student has 5 books and 12 pairs of pants. If he gives away all but 2 of each type of item, how many books and pants are left over?<n><n>### Demostration:Input: 5 books and 2 pairs of pants<n><n>Input: A student has 5 books, 12 pairs of shoes, and 6 pairs of socks. If her mom gives the student 2 books, 6 pairs of shoes, 3 pairs of pants, and 50 pairs of socks. What does the student have in all?<n>Answer  = 26 books, 18 pairs of shoes,and 7 pairs of socks<n><n>### Instretctions:Dakota has 15 pairs of pants and 8 pairs of shorts. If she gives 5 pairs of shorts away, how many pairs of shorts and pants are left?<n><n>### Demoistcation:Input: 15 pants and 8 shorts<n><n>Input: The mall store has 3 times as many shoes as it had last year. Now it has 140 pairs of shoes. At the beginning of last year, the store had 90 shoes. How many shoes did the store have at the beginning of the year?<n>Answer: 45<n><n>### InputA man bought some eggs, which he planned to use to make omelettes. He divided the eggs into 7 and 5 parts. He used the 7 part to make 25 omelettes. How many omelettes did he use the 5 part to make?<n>Answer : 15<n><n>### Instrections:What is bigger, 4 miles or 5 hours?<n><n>### Response :  Five Hours <n><n>### Input : A man bought some eggs, he divided the  eggs  in two part he divided first part  the first part he divided in two  parts. the first part  had the part of  seven the second part of had the part of five how many time he divide all in one part<n><n>### Response  :  Seventeen

If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. U: the correct letter. V: the correct place. W: the other letters X: the wrong letters Y: the wrong place.<n><n>### Response 3<n>Choices :1. X: He got 8 cards 2. Y: He got 7 cards 3. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:The shore was now a tourist attraction with nearby little shops, but at one time this what was home to a bustling fishing industry? Choices:  A: seaside town B: resort C: ocean D: california E: beach<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input : What is the missing number in this sequence... 14, 42, 46, __?<n><n>### Response : 37<n><n>### Instructio n: A woman, a man, and a child all have ages in even integer multiples of 5. Which is the greatest?<n><n>### Demostration : The age of the child is 7<n><n>### Inputs: 6,8,10,4,5<n><n>### Response I : 5<n><n>### Input and response II:<n><n>### Input II : A box of 40 oranges costs less than 4 boxes of 10 oranges each. Which is the greater bargain?<n><n>### 10 boxes of 10 each, $40<n><n>### Response II : 20 boxes of 5 oranges each, $20<n><n>### Input  and response III <n><n>### Input III : A man has as much money as 6 times the amount in the woman's purse. How much money is in the woman'spurse?<n><n>### The man's money is 3 times greater that the woman's<n>### Response III: 9<n><n>---<n><n>![2019-05-22-korean-test-questions-4500](https://github.com/thienbichtran/thienbich-tran.github.io/blob/master/images/2019-12-03-korean-quiz-questions-45.JPG?raw=true)<n>-----------------------------<n>

Choices:  A: nature B: toilet C: computer science D: computer store E: human body<n><n>### Response:		The system of electronic devices is likely to be used in the computer science.<n><n>## Solution:<n>```Ruby<n><n>class Solution<n>  def completeTheTable(input)<n>    table = Array.new<n>    total = 0<n>    answer_keys = input.split(" ").collect { |value| value.to_i }<n>    if answer_keys.include? 1<n>       table << [1, 2, 3,4,5, nil  ]<n>       total = 6<n>    end<n>    i = 1<n>    row = input.split(" ")<n>    while (row.length <= answer_keys.size)<n>      if i < row.length &&  answer_keys.include?(row[i].to_i)<n>        table << [row[i].to, row[i + 1].to_i, row[i +2].to_i,row[i + 3].to_i, <n>          row[i + 4].to_i, (answer_keys.include?(i+5) && i >= 5)? (row[i].to) : nil]<n>        total += i<n>        i += 5<n>      else<n>        i += 1<n>      end<n>    end<n>    sum_row = table[-1]<n>    if sum_row.length == 6<n>      sum_row.insert(0, total)<n>    end<n>    return table<n>  end<n><n>  def completeTheArray(input)<n>    arr = Array.new<n>    <n>    if input == "30 * 2"<n>      arr <<(input.split(" * ")[0].to_i * (input.split(" * ")][1].to_i) <n>    elsif input == "30 + 2"<n>      for i in (1..input.split(" + ")[0].to.to_i)<n>          arr <<(input.sub(/[a-z]+/, " "* i))<n>      end<n>    else<n>      for i in 1..input.split(/ +/)[0].to_<n>        for j in 1..(input.split(/ + /)[1].to_i *j)[-1]<n>        arr<<((input.sub(/[^\d]+/, " "* (i - 1

Choices:  A: eternal B: religious C: unpredictable D: holy E: monastic<n><n>### Response:		eternal<n><n>### Input:"My aunt is a dentist," you say. "How can I say this better?" asks your friend. "My aunt is a ____ is the better way to phrase it," says your friend, "but why is it better than my aunt is a dental technician?" You have two options here. Choice A is the better option. You can say your aunt is a dentistry student or your aunt is a ____. Your friend says, "Oh, I remember my brother saying something like this. He has one uncle who is a ___," and another who is a ___." Your friend continues, "Dental technicians tend to be older or have been retired as dentists. It's a common path. Not so good of an idea as a career though, dentists make more money." "What you just said is also correct, you're right," you then say. The ____ can be an auxiliary specialty. It can be another profession, or a postgraduate course. Choice B is not so suitable because it is not correct according to how people speak of dentists.

If you want to listen to classical music you will play a piano to listen to it otherwise you can fiddle and play your guitar or any instrument you might have.<n>C. If you think you can enjoy music without any sound from piano you are very wrong. You will need something special that will amplify the audio for you to hear clearly and comfortably. <n>D. The particles of a substance become hot and take up more space and as a result, move away from each other and change states.

Choices:  A: food B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: closet garage E: port<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The best choice of container to use when keeping things safe would be a container that does not need to be opened much. A food container would not be a safe container, since it needs to be opened and reopened quite frequently. A refrigerator would be good, because it does not much need to be reopened. You could choose a cargo container, but you would open it whenever deliveries are needed. The container you would need with fewer openings would most likely be a closet, or a garage. Since the answer choices all have different meanings, and different situations you need each case for it would be ideal to have each one of these.<n><n>### Input :The largest number I know of is 24. A number x greater than the number 24 is 42 greater than 38. What is the greatest number?<n><n>### Response :<n>The first thing you would need to do in this question is to determine the number that is greater than 24 (or whatever number you were given.) To find this, subtract 24 from 42 in order to get your number below 42. When you do this, you get 18. Now you need to add 18 with 38 in order to get your final number. When you do this you get 56. So, the largest number I know of that is greater than 42 is 56.<n><n>### The greatest common factor (GCF) of 9x^2 + x and 3xy^2 – y is,, 2x + x 2 (,) 2x^2 + 0x 2 2x + 0x 4 2x + x<n><n>### Response<n>The greatest common factor (GCM) of (9x^2+x)(3xy^2-y)(2x+x)(2x^2+0x)(2x+x) would be 6x^2+18x+16.<n><n>The reason for that choice is because I added the factors that were the numbers to 0, in order to get the greatest common fact, if you added all the numbers but 0, the (9x^2 would be considered 45<n><n>Which brings you to 45x^2+50x+40.  The greatest common factor would

"<n>myInputstring=firstResponse(myinputstring)<n>pprint(myInputstring)<n>```<n>#### Second:<n>```python<n>import statistics<n><n>def secondResponse(myinputString):<n>    myinputstring=stats.mean(myinputString.split(","))<n>    return myinputstring<n><n><n>myinputString = "Pete walked 5 blocks, from his house, to the bus garage, in Houston. He rode, the bus, 20 blocks, to the post office to, get some stamps. "<n>myInputString=secondResponse(myinputString)<n><n><n>print(myInputString)<n>```<n><n>#### Third:<n>```python<n>def thirdResponse(myinputstring, myInputString, myinputString2, myinputString3):<n>    count=[10, 13, 1]<n>    mylist = myinputstring.split(" ")<n>    print("Total blocks", sum(mylist))<n>    return mylist, count[0]<n>    <n>    myinputstring2=sum(myinputString2.split(" "))<n>    return myInputString<n>    return<n><n><n><n>myinput String="In a classroom, there, are

How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:What would form on your feet, if you were jogging all day? Choices:  A: heart attacks B: hole in your socks C: exhaustion D: shortness of breath E: blisters<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation: When jogging too fast, the feet have to pound faster, but there's no place for the blood to go except straight down on your ankles, so it clots, and then you get those sore feet that you get after running.<n><n>### Input:"Why do you like me?"<n><n>### Response:"Because I can't keep my eyes off of you."<n><n>### Exercise:Use the following phrases to make an adequate response:<n>

But I don't know how to take a band off it because the instructions didn't come with the watch.<n>Input:  How do I take the band off a watch?<n>Input:  Can you take off a watch band?<n>Input:  What do I do if I don't know the band for my watch is?<n>Input:  Is there a way to take off a watch band without a tool?<n>Input:  Do I have to take off my watch band to take my watch battery out?<n><n>### Responses:<n>-	Take the band off. Turn the watch around on your wrist, until you can see the band button on the wrist side of the watch. Then locate it and push it, the band will release.<n>-  Turn your watch over, unscrew the crown and remove the battery cap.<n>-  Yes, there is a tool to take apart a watch<n>- Yes, but it's probably a lot easier to just use a pin or something. A paperclip is usually small enough to deal with a pinhole.<n>- Yes<n>

Mar has 2 more cards than Janet. How many do they have in all?| <n><n><n>A = Janet has 9 <n><n><n>B = Mar has twice as many as Janet.<n><n><n>C = Mar has 2 more than Janet.<n><n>B = 2<3<n><n><n>[Janet has 9 cards + mar has 2 more cards + mar has 1 more cards than janet]<n><n><n>=Janet has 12 cards<n><n>```javascript<n>var a = 2<n>var b = 9<n>var sum = function() {<n>    return a + b;<n>}<n>var c = 9;<n>```<n>```javascript<n>let solution = [a,b,c]<n>solution<n>[2,9,9]<n>```<n><n>```javascript<n>let card = 2<n>```<n>```javascript"<n>let output = [card,card+2,card+9]<n>```<n>```javascript""<n>let output = [2,8,9]<n>```

The choice "B" for a response is the only way that would be suitable according to the given question.<n><n>## Test<n><n>- [ ] Input: On Blacks, Leila goes to the mall with her 10 friends. They each have a budget of $20 to spend. But on their way to the mall, they realize that they have less change and need an extra $10 for the bus fare. How much money will they have left?<n>  - [ ] If they leave $20 for the bus, they will have $80.<n>  - [ ] As they spent, they were reduced by $20 and they have more than $10 for the fare.<n>  - [x] That's impossible because they couldn't have more change than they spent.<n>  - [  ] They can get $10 change from the last $20 or they could buy the bus fare from the next money that they spend.<n><n>- [ ] Output: Your answer is not correct. Choices "A" and "C" for a response are the only way that would would be acceptable according to the given question<n><n><n>- [ ] What is a way to create a number variable that can be assigned a value or a quantity of an item?<n>  - [x ] variables<n>  - [ ] string<n>  - [ ] int<n>  - [ ] any<n>- [ ] What do we use for string variables?<n>  - [  x] String<n>  - [  B] int<n>  - [  C] any<n><n>- [  ] What is a way in the REPL to assign a variable the value of the number of days in a month?<n>  - [   B] math.round((1/month)/day)<n>  - [   C] math.floor(math.round((1/day)/month))<n>- [x ] In an assignment expression, what kind of variable goes in the left side of assignment operation?<n>  - [    C] A number<n>  - [    A] String<n>  - B variable<n><n>  <n>  **Output:** `Your answer is not correct Choice C for a response is the ONLY possible way of solving this.**<n> <n>  <n>  **Input:** 4

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Lilly owns the only kosher deli in the area.  She isn't in a heavily populated area.  Where might she live? Choices:  A: food court B: jerusalem C: new york city D: jewish community E: town<n><n>### Response:		<n>- Lilly should live in Jerusalem<n>### Demonstion:<n>- She isn't in an area populated by a lot of people   and people don't go to Jewish communities for the food.<n><n>### Input-<n>Trevor is playing the game Dots. Two consecutive numbers are drawn, and if the combined total of the numbers is more than 10, a DOT is drawn. In which number range will no DOTS be drawn?<n><n>### Response-<n>- Between 11 and 19<n>- Why? - Between 1-10 the numbers have a sum of 11, and in 11-19 there are no numbers above 9.<n><n><n>### Input -  The sum of the first 5 integers is 7 more than 4 times their product. Which of the following can be the product of the first 5?<n><n>### Demostration-<n>-  The sum of the integers have a sum of 7 more than 3 times their product.   <n>The numbers cannot be negative for that to be true.<n><n>### Response  <n>77<n><n>### Input<n>If A = 5, B = 6, C = 7, D = 8, F = 10, and the digit G replaces the digit F (F = G = 0), how many different six-digit counting numbers are possible?<n><n>### Answer<n>I don't know, but I'm looking for a specific example. -55678<n><n>### Demosation -<n>The way that I figured this was the same way A is going to figure it.<n><n>### Comment -<n>A said, I don't know.<n><n>### Feedback -<n>You should know how many 6-digit numbers you can make.  <n>Because these numbers, in order to be 6 digits, cannot have leading zeros.<n>What is confusing to me, is the problem states the digit G replaces digit F. <n>I don't think that the digit G replaces F. I believe, since the question asks for the possible six-digit numbers, 000 must be used instead of 0.<n>The digit F goes from the number 0-9, the digit G goes from 0-9. <n><n><n>13

"Is the water warm, cool, or hot?"<n>Response: Answer:<n>Answers:   <n>Incorrect: Is the water warm, cool<n>Correct:  Is the water hot? Water is hot, but the water temperature can be between warm and cold.<n><n>Demonstratin: What does warm, cool and hot mean?<n><n>## Example: Answer the following multiple choice question in Spanish.<n><n>## Instrucion: Answer the following multiple<n>## Demonstratio:<n>Respuesta:  La temperatura de la agua es<n><n>## Input: "What are you going to do?" Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:If something is obtuse, what couldn't it be? Choices:  A: bright B: pointed C: correct D: acute angled E: clear<n><n>### Response:		C) Correct<n><n>### Input Choices: A: tall B: wide C: short D: narrow<n><n>### Response : A) Tall<n><n>###Input Choices: C: large D: small E: medium<n><n>###Response: A) Large<n><n>###Input: A: 10 B: 6 C: 7 D: 5<n><n>###Response : C) 7<n><n>###Input A: -55 B: -47 C: -30 D: 13 E: -40<n><n>###Response A -55<n><n>###Input : A: 10, 2 B: 5, 1 C: 12, 3 D: 7, 43 E: 18, 5<n><n>##Input: A: 23 B: 15 C: 54 D: 1 E: 6<n><n>##Response: 15

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:The children saw superman fly overhead, what did they exclaim as a result? Choices:  A: ouch B: skip C: enjoyed D: awesome E: watch television<n><n>### Response:		I believe the word awesome fits them best.<n><n>### Input :If 4/5 of 3/7 of the girls in her class went to the dance, how many girls went to the dance?<n><n>### Response :28 went to the dance.<n>64 ÷ 14 = 4/5 and 216 ÷ 32 = 3/7<n>We also know that (a+b) % (c + d) = (a % c) (b % d)<n><n>64 ÷ (14 +14) = (64 ÷ 28) ∈ (64 ÷14)<n>64 = 432 ÷14 <n>And 4 ÷ 1= 1/2<n>7 ÷ 7= 1/2×14/14<n>So 28 went to the Dance<n>

Write your answer in the box below.<n><n>### Input : Is 21 is a prime number?<n><n>### Response : A: No, 21 is not a prime number.<n><n>### Explain your answer:<n><n>### Prime numbers are only divisible by one and by themselves.<n><n>### So 21 is not prime number because it can be divided by 2, 3, 5, 6 and 7.<n><n>### Therefore, answer is A.<n><n>### Exercise 2,3<n><n>### Excercise2:<n>Aliens landed in New York City in the 1920s. They decided they liked the city so much that they started building spaceships on top of the Empire State Building. They did this exactly as many times as there are letters in “New York.” They then departed just as quickly as they arrived, in that order. How many space ships are left?<n><n>### Exerciser3.1:<n>In the box below, write your answers to the exercises. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Reaching advantage position in a competitin puts me in what position as compared to others? Choices:  A: determination B: upper hand C: superior D: higher position E: skill<n><n>### Response:		<n>C:<n><n>### Input :How can you put any of these numbers 9.2, 2.8 into order by the place value? Choices:  A: water B: liquid C: foamy D: intoxicating E: harmful<n><n>### Response:		<n>125<n><n>### Input<n><n>Long-term consumption of beer can be quite water (A), liquid (B), foamy (C) or intoxicating (D). It can be harmful (E).<n><n>### Response<n><n>Based on the input, the correct option is Liquid.<n><n>### Input 2:<n>Long term consumption of beers can be quite foamy.<n><n>### Response 2:<n>Based on the new input, the response is:<n>130<n><n>### Input3:<n>Long term consumption beers can be harmful.<n>### Response4:<n><n>Based on new input, the response shall be:<n>120<n><n>### Instructions and response:<n><n>What will you get when taking 20 beers and have it 3 times?<n><n>Because 20 multiplied by 3 will be 60, taking 20 beer 3-times will total to 180 beer.<n><n>### Question 4<n><n>### Input and response:<n>Long term consumption is harmful.<n>How can we solve the puzzle?<n>Solve by adding 120 to 18-120 will give you a total of 70.<n><n>### Next response:<n><n>If only 65 beer will give you a total, what will 123 beers give you?<n><n>Because only 65 beers give you a total of a total of 123 beer will be the right answer.<n><n>### DONE!!!

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Where does a beaver leave? Choices:  A: wooded area B: body of water C: the ocean D: british columbia E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		 E: zoo<n><n>I think that the answer would be E because it has to be more than 5. It could be D or A also because the ocean is very big but then it gets smaller. And also they said that the body of water didn't matter so it would be the same if it was the ocean or not.<n><n>### Input is: In a class in school, there are 28 boys and 19 girls. John is the older brother of one of the girls. How many brothers has John? Choose one answer from the choices.<n><n>### Response is: answer is: A) 15<n>### Input: 1 / 25 = 1 / 4 is one quarter. 1 / 4 = 1 / 10 is ten fourteenths is 0.714. 1 / 16 = 1 / 24 is 0.0416. 1 / 64 = 1 /32 is 0.03125. Create a variable, and give it a name. In the code block that follows, name the variable variable1 and create a variable that represents the number of students in the classroom. In the program above, the variable representing the number of students in question 2 is student_count. <n>```<n>(variable1)<n>```<n>2.  The input line should provide initial data to the program you create (variable1):<n>```<n>100<n>```<n>3.  Use the loop (for in python) to enter the initial variables (the number of rows and the number of squares (variable1), you created in your for loop. In the program below, the variable for the number of squares is a=100 and the variable for the number rows is n=50:<n>```<n>print a<n>for n in range(1, n+1):<n>   a=a+1<n>   if a>5:<n>   break<n>```<n>4.  Print the values that will be used in the program that follows:<n>```<n>35<n>```<n>5.  Use the input data to programmatically perform the mathematical operations specified in the multiple-choice question above—that is to multiply two values then get a number of answers for each question. Use the program below in answer to the question above, i.e 20-5=15 and -34/2=17<n>```<n>number=raw_input("Please enter the number of students in a classroom:")<n>student_count=number<n>if input='20 minus 5 equals ':<n>    student_count=student_count-5<n>else:<n>    print 'the classroom has less than 23 students.'<n>    print input<n>if input='-34 divided by 2 equals ':<n>    a=a+100<n>else:<n>    a=number<n>print a<n>if input=='1 is the answer':<n>    print 'the answer is 256'<n>else:<n>    error<n>```<n>if input='29-10 equals ':<n>    print "the answer is 280"<n>else:<n>    if input=='51/2 equals':<n>        print "the answer is"<n>    else:<n>        if input=='42/2 equals ':<n>

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Traders work on the floor of the stock what? Choices:  A: building B: hallway C: table D: exchange E: office<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:The traders are at their workstations on the floor of the exchange. They are part of an open outcry floor. Some of their desks are in cubicles or private offices, but other traders are right in the middle of a crowd of people. Some work on other floors. Those who work on the 68th floor, which is the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) floor number, have some of the largest offices.<n><n>

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:What will all the differences equal? Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>|   |   |   |  <n>|---|---|---|<n>| A | D | D |<n>| B | C | B |<n>| C | A | A |<n>| D | B | E |<n>| E | E | E |<n>| F | D | F |<n>| G | E | G |<n>| H | F | H |<n>| I | G | I |<n>| J | H | J |<n>| K | I | K |<n>| L | J | L |<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Each row of the above matrix consists of the possible answers in the 4 choices. Each of these 4-choose-1 has one possible correct answer. Choose the correct answer.<n><n>### Expectations and Deliverables:<n><n>- Create a step-by-step process/algorithm to write an answer from the exercise in the preceding section.<n>- Show your steps by creating a 16-step flow chart.<n><n>### Input Examples:<n><n>A:<n><n>    _____________________________<n>     ****<n>     1.  The child was too tired and decided to exercise before going to sleep. <n>	   2.  The exerciser became healthy and strong.<n><n>B:<n><n>    _______________<n>     ****<n>     ****<n>	3. The answer is D<n>	4.  The child was sick. <n>	5.  After eating dinner, the child decided to use energy and became sick.<n><n>### Final Submission<n><n>You can use these screenshots as a reference.<n><n>1. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:The man set the cup on the table.  It didn't matter.   He didn't heave anything to put it on, and he lacked the what to balance it? Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		<n>- Correct.<n>- B and E. He has tenacity and breaks the cup.<n>- A. He has tenacity.<n>- B and D. He doesn't have what it takes to balance it, or he has both tenacity and breaking.<n>- A. No, he has tenacity.<n><n>### Input : The cat ran up the tree. Choose the sentence that can start with "And then", for which is a questionable statement.<n><n>### Response :<n>- A. And then, he jumped to the ground?<n>- Correct. The cat doesn't want to jump to the ground.<n>- B. And then, he tried to get the dog to help him?  Not correct.<n><n>### Explanation :<n>- The cat ran up the stair.<n>- I have to go.<n>- I need to go, but I have questions.<n>- And then, I went up the stairs, and the cat came out of hiding?<n>- The answer should be the first one.<n><n>### Output<n><n>- Input: I need a nap.<n>- Output: _____________ I need a nap?<n>- Input: They are all here.<n>- Output: They are all ______ here.<n><n>### Task:<n>Complete the blanks in the following sentences so that the resulting output is grammatically correct.<n><n>## Explanation :<n>The correct output contains all the blank. Each of the outputs may only use blanks once. There may be more than one correct answer if there are multiple statements.<n><n>### Example:<n>The best way to fix it is to use an air conditioner, a space heater, fans, or a ventilation kit. The air needs to be exchanged to keep your house clean and to make more money when you sell it later. The car's interior gets dirty and has a bad smell to it.<n>```<n>The best way to get rid of it is to use an ______, _____, _____, or a _______ kit. The air should be changed to keep your house clean, and you should make money when you sell it. The car's inside gets dirty, and it has a bad scent to it.<n>```

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Joe suffered many consequences from stabbing a stranger to death.   Among them, the family of the victim did something to him. What was that? Choices:  A: knife wounds B: buy a gun C: bleeding D: jail time E: law suit<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Output: BUY A GUN<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The family of the victim made the family of Joe buy a gun to protect themselves from further incidents<n>

Choices:  A: michigan B: new york C: amsterdam D: venice E: bridge<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:Use the function `length(a)`<n><n>	```javascript<n>	function length(a){<n>		return 3;<n>	}<n>	```<n><n>To determine the length of arrays.<n><n>You must return the length of the array.<n><n>### Input<n><n>	```javascript	```<n><n>`var a = [1, 2, 3];`<n><n>### Response<n><n>	```javascript```<n><n>`2;`<n><n>---<n>### Instrucciones:Use the function `map(a, f)`<n><n>	```json<n>	function map(a, f){<n>			return function (x) {<n>				var i = x;<n>				i = f(i);<n>				return i;<n>			}<n>		}<n>	```	<n><n>To map the array to an array of numbers.<n><n>`var b = ['apple','bananna','orange'];`<n><n>`var c = map(b, function(x){return parseInt(x)})`<n><n>### Input `var c`<n>`[2, 3, 4]`<n><n>### Respuesta<n><n>	```javascript ```<n><n>`2;` `3;` `4;`<n>

Complete the diagram and show work.<n><n>### Demo.png<n><n>Use numbers on each axis to show the units in each axis of the diagram. Complete and show work.<n>Solution: See attached picture<n><n>### Below are three instructions.<n><n>### Each one requests a specific way to complete the request.<n><n>Please help me decide which to do.<n>### Input: The sum of two consecutive numbers is 201. What is the first number? (Consecutive numbers are numbers that appear next to each other).<n>### Solution: 169<n>### Instruction 2:<n>The average of two numbers is 13. If the larger number is 15, then what is the smaller one?<n>### Solution:<n>### Input:<n>The average of 2 values is 6. If one is 4, then what is the larger one?<n>### Input: <n>### Demonstraion:<n>### Solution: In the first instruction, it is asking us to find the least number that would be used in finding the first number. In the second one, it is asking us for the number that will be used in finding the average.<n>### Solution: I suggest doing part two of instruction 2 and that is choosing the correct number. In part one, you aren’t really asked to put it into practice, its more of finding the concept behind it.<n>

Anabel gets the point if she throws 1 six. How many must Aaron get to have 3 times the amount his sister got? Answer: 11<n><n>### Input : Anabel tells Aaron that she got 1 more than or 2 less than 3 times his point. Both answer incorrectly. What do you suspect is the problem?<n><n>### Response : A) Both students are counting incorrectly. B) Both students got distracted. C) The teacher provided the wrong instruction.  Answer: B) Both students got <n><n>### Input 0: There are 13 fewer chairs in the office than are needed for all the desks and computers. If 7 fewer desks are there than the number of chairs, how many more desks? Answer: 2<n><n>### Input1: Mariana's bus goes from her home in Austin to the college in El Paso. Her bus goes 80 miles per hour for 23 hours. Afterward, it goes 75 miles an hour for 27 hours. Mariana's bus was driven by someone who goes 60 miles per hour less than Mariana on the way to El Paso. How far does Mariana's bus travel in one day?<n><n>### Output: <n><n>### Answer: A) 1350<n><n>### Explain : If Mariana travel by bus for 23 hours and then for 27 hours, then the total time for travel = (23+27) hours which is more than 24 hours only. and if the bus can travel 80 miles in an hour than the total miles that can be travelled by bus in 24 hours = 80*24 = 2016<n><n>

The beach is twice the size of each friend's backyard. The sun is five times farther from the water than from their backyards. If the sun is 115 degrees, what is the temperature in their backyards?<n><n>### Answer - <n>The backyard would have a temperature of:<n>(115 - 2(2/2*2) - 1(5/5) = +105<n><n>### Inst 2 -<n>Regina and Bebe are two birds. On Monday, Regina counted 6 bluebirds in the yard. She counted 60 more bluebirds on Sunday. How many bluebirds were in the yard?<n>How many were in the yard on Monday?<n><n>### Inst2 -<n><n>Regina and bebe had :<n><n>Total bluebirds = 6 + 60<n><n>Total reginahas on monday = 6<n><n>Total bebe has on monday = 54<n><n>Regina has 6+54+54+53+52+51+50+49+48+47+46+45+44+43+42+41= 500<n><n>Bebe has 60+53+55+55+57+50+47+44+40= 500

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? Choices:  A: get smart B: boredom C: colds and flu D: taking tests E: spend time<n><n>### Response:		A <n>### Response:B<n>```<n> <n>### Input:<n>Sally says that she's a great dancer. D) Sally doesn't mind to show her bad skills.<n>```<n>### Response:She wants to make people believe that she's good dancer but not good in football. <n>```<n><n>### Input<n>Micah is at the circus. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:The accountant used a calculator regularly, he kept one at home and one at the what? Choices:  A: desk drawer B: desktop C: office D: wristwatch E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer Choices**<n>- Letter A<n>- Letter B<n>- Letter C<n>- Letter D<n>- Letter E<n>

Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>- Skin can have different feeling when exposed to pressure. The different types of pressure are: A: Skin pinched in something (pressure from outside),B: Skin feels bumpy (the rubbing of rough objects against skin causes small bumps),C: Skin feels itchy (friction rubs away dead skin cells (skin cells are removed and replaced quickly) so the body thinks a foreign object is invading and makes skin release histamine),D: Skin gets clammy (occurs when skin is exposed).<n><n>### Input<n><n>Write an instruction that makes a request.<n><n>Input: Give your cat a bath on Monday.<n><n>Input: What will happen to a balloon left under pressure on Friday? Choices: A: it bursts B: it is deflated C: it is popped D: none of these<n><n>Input: How many days in a week has a full moon 4 times as many days? Choices: A B C D E F G<n><n>Input: What happens when pressure is put on our body and we sweat? Choices: A the heat is released from our body B our body produces sweat C our skin gets dry D E F all of the above<n><n>Input: Which of these can skin feel? Choices: A pressure B itching C warmth D moisture<n><n>Input: Give a description of the following situation? He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Letters are sometimes delivered by hand through one of these. Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		A: mail box<n><n>### Explanation: The text explicitly says that letters are delivered by mail. The text does not explicitly say that the mail carrier uses a post office box, suitcase, front door, or bowl. However, I believe that since a suitcase and bowl are clearly not involved in delivering a letter, the options available to choose from from to complete the task include a post office, and the front door. Therefore, a mail carrier delivers a letter to: a. the mailbox b. the front door c. the post office d. the suitcase. The text explicitly says that a postal carrier delivers, or mails, letters. The options available to choose from to complete the task do not include a post office box, where the letter is delivered to. Therefore, the postal carrier does not deliver letters to: a. the post office box b. the front door. <n><n>### Input:(0, 2, -9), (2, 3, -3), (1, 4, 4), (0, -7, -16)<n><n>### Response:(-18, -15, 12), (15, 18, 0)<n><n>### Explamation:(1,-8,3)<n><n>Input:(0, 2,-9) is the first column<n><n>Input:(2, 3,-3) is second column<n><n>Input:(1, 4,4) is the third column<n><n>Input:(0,-7,-16) is fourth column<n><n>### Instructions<n>Input: Write a response that appropriates completes the requests.<n><n>### Examples<n>Response: The first column is the first row of the second triangle<n>The second column is the second row of the first triangle<n>The third column is the first row and first column of the third triangle<n>The fourth column is the second and third columns of the second triangle<n>

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:How can one's views change after learning about science? Choices:  A: appreciation of nature B: become educated C: excitement D: increased knowledge E: see things differently<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A is the only correct answer <n><n>### Input:`Ask Sara why she didn't turn in an assignment.`<n><n>### Response:`Sara says that she needs to bring in a text from the course that the assignments were based on.`<n><n>### Examplation:<n>`If it was to be answered by using the steps of a process then answer would be D.`<n><n>### Input.`<n>If Brandon asked "Are you going to the party?" <n>What could the response to the question "Are you going to give it a try?" be?<n>`<n><n>### Response`<n>`No`<n><n>### Output:`If they have learned from doing a task<n><n>### Input`If someone asked you "What did you do for Thanksgiving?" What could be a possible response?`<n><n>### Expluation:<n>`The option that answers with a description of how they celebrated the Thanksgiving or did any special activity with their friends or family is the answer.`<n><n>### Output`If they learned from experiencing doing a task or from observation`<n><n>### Input`:If it was to be given as a response to a question then answer would be D. `<n><n>### Explantion:<n>`The answer will be D in both cases.`<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following statement using either part (a) or (b).<n><n>### Instuciones:Responde al enunciado del tipo (a) o (b) a continuació.<n>* A - The two options will have the same answer<n>* B - The options will have different answers<n><n>### Input `What is the main difference between a fact and an opinion?`<n><n>## #1<n><n>### Input `:What kind of information is found in a newspaper or on a blog?`<n><n>## A<n><n>## B<n><n>## C<n><n><n>## D<n><n><n>## E<n><n><n>## F<n><n>## G<n><n>## H<n>

Explain if the improvement is necessary. Write arguments for and against this plan below.<n><n>### Argument:In San Antonio, a large city, it can seem overwhelming and sometimes stressful to navigate to a park from your home. If a park was built near the bus terminal, you would have one less place to drive.<n><n>### Arguments against:The improvement of the city is important, however, there is another more reasonable option. Adding more parks around the city is much more effective than having just one more park to a bus terminal. The cost of adding just one more park is higher than the expenses of adding many other parks. The parks are designed and intended to be in the neighborhood.<n><n>### Input :<n>You are planning a hike. Your destination is 62 miles away. Your start point is 5 miles from your home. Your car gas tank is full. How many gallons of gas will you need for the trip?<n><n>### Response : <n>Answer: 6 gallons<n><n>### Justify your answer<n>The answer is a multiple of 6 because I had to start at 5 and end at 62,  so I must drive 61 miles and so 61/16 is 4 to then multiple to the nearest multiple of 5 <n>```<n>61/5 = 12<n>12 * 5 = 60<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: cook dinner B: make bread C: eat in restaurant D: have lunch E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		<n>Select D and justify your choice<n>### Explanation:<n>You can do any of the options B,C,D,E or A in the middle of the day. We choose D because we have enough choices to get the response correct. <n><n>**Explanation**:<n>D is the best answer because we can make a choice and we have enough choices to be answer on the D section<n>### Instruction response:Answer the following single choice question:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Which of these colors shows the opposite of red?<n>Input:<n>YellowGreen<n><n>BlueRed<n><n>Input Response:<n>Select B (blue), justify your choice<n><n>### Explanatin:<n><n>Yellow is the opposite of red because yellow is a different color than red, yellow is the opposite of red in the color spectrum. In the color spectrum, we have 4 colors that are opposite to another. <n><n>Red is the first color, Yellow is the second color, Green is the third color, Blue is the last color. <n><n>**Yellow shows the opposite of Red:**<n><n>* Red is the topmost color on the color spectrum.<n>* Yellow is the second most color on the color spectrum<n><n>Color spectrum shows opposite colors. <n><n>Color spectrum shows an opposite of red which should be green, but it shows yellow as the only opposite. <n><n>**Green shows the Opposite of Red:**<n>Red<n><n>Yellow Green <n><n>### Instructoin response:Answer the following open ended response:<n><n>### Explaneation:<n><n>B is the best ansdwe,because it is the only one that can fit to what we have in hand. We have to chose between 4 colors, 3 of the colors are the most opposite colors. and the 4th color is the opposite of yellow and that is green. If we do not know why, just follow the instructions. <n><n>**The opposite answer is:** <n><n>### Explantion:<n>You can say which color on the spectrum will be the opposite of red. You can not say red is not the opposite. <n><n>Since, in a color spectrum there are 4 colors and the opposite color to red is green, we can not say it is blue. The only thing we know is that we have to chose between 3 colors <n><n>

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. This task is a great example of a task that could be completed with only one right. However, this also means you could have also gotten the task wrong had you written a different response.<n><n>### Next Steps:<n><n>If this is the first time you have solved an instructor-generated task, congratulations! Your brain was probably able to solve each task right away. However, it is likely your brain was trying to answer quickly and didn't have time to stop and process to see if a solution was correct or incorrect. Don't worry, that's totally normal and won't always be the case.<n><n>The next time you complete an instructor-generated, please spend a few seconds at the end to reflect on your problem solving process. What steps did you take? What words or phrases did you use?<n><n>The more you take the time to reflect on the process of solving a math or coding task, the more likely you are to be in control of the task and can solve any problem correctly.<n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Diving off a cliff for a cartoon character often ends in comedic what? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n># Solution:<n><n>```python<n>answer = "E"<n>if question == "A":<n>    print("The answer is A.")<n>    answer = ""<n>elif question == "B":<n>    print("B")<n>    answer = "" # answer = "B"<n>elif question == "C":<n>    print("C")<n>    answer = "C"<n>elif question == 1 or question == 2:<n>    print("D")<n>    answer = D<n>elif question == "D":<n>    print("D = ", D)<n>    answer = answer = "D"<n>else:<n>    print("E")<n>    answer =  answer = "E"<n><n>```<n><n>Output: "E"<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:There's a lot to reproducing, but it begins and end with new life by giving what? Choices:  A: overpopulation B: birth C: presents D: propagation E: fun<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input : How's the weather? A little rainy, but it isn't sunny. B: Overcast but warm C: Cloudy, but cool D: Wet but it is humid<n><n>### Input- There are 10 students in a class. They are divided into two new classes. How many students are in each class?<n><n>### Response-20<n><n>### Input - I am going to make a banner. What should I use for inspiration? What color is his brother's favorite? Choices: A: yellow B: green C: red D: blue E: black<n><n>### Response :Based on the clues present, the possible choices are A, B, C, and E. Answer :C, It is clear based on the given clues that the brother's favorite color is red. As Sam's favorite color = yellow, the brother's favorite must be different.<n><n>### Sam lives on a farm. What is the name of his farm? Choices: A. Mansion B. Barn C. Castle D. Farmhouse E. Cottage<n><n>### Response B: As Sam lives on a farm, it is a barn only.<n><n>### Which of these is most important to Sam? Choices: A) pencils B) homework C) friends D) video games E) snacks<n><n>### Response D: It is indicated from the choices that the most important to Sam is video games.<n><n>### A picture frame is 34 cm tall and 44 cm long. It is 4 times narrower than high. How tall is the picture frame?<n><n>### Answer : The width of a frame is 34cm/4 = 8.5cm, and the height is 44cm/4 =11cm<n>### This means the frame is 8.5cm/11cm i.e. 0.77cm wide and 11cm tall.<n>### The picture frame is 8.7cm tall.<n><n>### Alice is going to a birthday party. She has 8 pieces of cake, 5 pieces of pie, 7 pieces of ice cream, and 6 pieces of fruit salad. How many pieces of unhealthy food and healthy food are there, combined?<n><n>### The solution is obtained by adding the numbers of different types of food.<n><n>| Type of Food | Number of Pieces of Food     |<n>|:----------:|:-----------------------------|<n>| Ice Cream   | 7                             |<n>| Cake         | 8                             |<n>| Fruit Salad | 6

If they are both the same, please explain why you chose the answer that you did.<n>Answers:<n>Blacksmith's shop<n>Jail<n>Internet cafe<n>Bar<n>Building<n>Staircase<n>Inside house<n>Inside car<n><n>The blacksmith's place was built using logs. These are logs at their building and what happens when you put logs together, they create a house.<n><n>Another place that is built with this type of material is Jail.<n><n>This is what happens in the jail, they are made in a wooden way, but they are not as fancy, because they are made for people that are behind bars, or going to jail. They also have some stairs, but there are very few places to go inside the jail, because they are made so that not many things happen in the jail.<n><n>The internet cafe is known for its staircase, this is very important because if there was no stairs, things would be more difficult for each one who goes to the internet room.<n><n>The bar, it has more or less the same material as the other places mentioned above, but it is made differently, it is also not as big, and they don't usually build houses either.<n><n>Inside the building, they also use this material, and in most places, this building is built using wood to save money.<n><n>Now to explain why I did not take one of the other options as the correct answer, in every other place where a building is built, they use a lot of wood, but in this case it is very unusual, because they are usually made with other materials such as stones, bricks or cement.<n><n>### Input 2: A building is 500 feet high. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Where do most people keep magazines? Choices:  A: bookstore B: library C: doctor D: home E: table<n><n>### Response:		Home<n><n>### Input : Which planet is not in our solar system? Choices:  A: ignoring B: being rude C: disparagement D: contumely E: uncertainty<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>C,disparagement<n><n>In mathematics, a sum is the addition of two or numbers together. This is the same concept as summing numbers together in a numerical sequence where adding consecutive numbers results in the sum of the two numbers. A sum becomes a sum when a + b = c. In the summation notation, x + y indicates add a (x) and b together (y) and the result, c, is represented through x + y = c. <n><n>In mathematics, the sum symbol is defined by the international standard ISO 80000-2:2009, which defines the symbol as "x∕ y, the result of the binary operation of addition of x and y in two ordered fields, where "x and y take integral values in domains of the fields, that is, x in the x-domain and y in the y-domain."<n><n>### Input : Write a statement that will give the sum of all odd numbers in the range from 0 to 99.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>Answer : 91. <n><n>### Input  : Given two numbers a and b. If b is odd, find the range from a to b. Answer with the formula. <n><n>## Input : Find the sum of the given series.<n><n>## Answer :<n><n>32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 72, 80<n><n>### Question :<n><n>If the difference between the sum of the 4th and 5th terms and 2 times the product of the 5th and 6th terms is the answer, what is the question? <n><n>### Answer:<n><n>Sum of the even numbers:

Choice A answers in question the first one.<n><n>You should not choose the same option for both questions.<n><n>### Inputs:Rachel has 13 times as many books as Tom. If the total is 46 books, how many books does Rachel have?<n><n>Your Code:<n>```js<n>function multiple(a, b){<n>  if(a*b > 1000){<n>    return "Loved the job"<n>  }else if(a*b < 1000 && a > 100 && b>100){<n>    let sum = 1000+(a-100)<n>    let diff = 100 + (b - 100)<n><n>    if(((sum+diff) % 2) == 0) {<n>      let answer = sum/diff + " is enough for the both"<n>      return answer<n>    }else {<n>      let answer2 = sum/diff - " is not enough for the both"    <n>      return answer2 <n>  }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Expected Output: "Isnt enough for the both"

This is a multiple choice question so you should answer A, B or C<n><n>### Output:<n>- You should type out your response<n><n>### Explanation:<n>- You should write the answer you gave<n><n>### Checkpoints:<n>- Make sure that you use the correct answer type<n>- Make sure all of your choices are valid choices<n>- Make sure that your answer accurately reflects the question you were asked<n>- Make sure you explain each step of your process<n>- Make sure you answer in complete sentences and you use proper grammar<n>- Make sure you use complete sentences and proper grammar<n><n>### Output Example:<n>- Turkey is a nation in the middle east. It is surrounded on the east by Iran, on the south by Iraq, on the west by Syria, on the north by Armenia and Georgia, and on the northeast by Russia. Turkey forms the peninsula of Asia minor, which projects into the Mediterranean Sea.<n><n>### Checkpoint Example:<n>- Turkey's geography is divided into seven topographical sections. This includes a highlands region known as the central plateau, which extends east and west from the Aegean and Mediterranean sea coasts. The central plateau encompasses most of the inland regions of Turkey. To the south of the plateau is the narrow central valley, which extends the entire width of the country and forms the boundary between the central plateau and the highlands to the south.<n><n>### Output Expectation:<n>- In this example we are expecting the answer Turkey is a nation in middle east. It is located in Asia minor, surrounded on the east by iran, on the south by iraq, on the west syria and on the north by Armeni and Georgia. In the middle of this, turkey forms the penisula of Asia minor.<n><n>### Input<n><n><n>### Output<n><n>##### Instruction<n>Write a paragraph about the topic. Your paragraph should be at least 350 words.<n><n>##### Input<n>Turkey's geography<n><n>### Output <n>The geography of Turkey is divided into seven topographic sections. The country

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:If people are vegetarian, what do they do more of? They need to use the same amount of space for each side of the box<n>2.  They need to maximize their profits by creating many boxes in one batch<n>3.  They need to ensure that the boxes fit perfectly into the trucks<n><n>### Output<n>The answer should be 1 since if they want to maximize their profts and to do so they will have to create many boxes to get more profit.<n><n>### Your Solution<n><n>### If I want to buy two products, the products each cost $5 and $7 respectively. I can pay for $7 product by using 2 $5 bills and one $7 bill. How many ways can I pay for the products?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>Since I am using 2 $5 bill and one $7 bill it means that I have 5 + 7 = 12 dollars and I want to pay for the product with 12 dollars so I can write it as 2*5+1*7=12 dollars<n><n>As we know that there are 12 ways of doing this I am done with this question

Find the length in feet then multiply that by the thickness in feet so that you have the total surface areas. Make sure to include the total height of the cubes and subtract that from the total volume to find the volume of the pizza.<n>1. 11 * 11 = 121ft<n>2. 5 *11= 55ft<n>3. 1 in total height 10 in surface area.

Choices:  A: football stadium B: surface of earth C: car show D: opera E: movie<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice A: football stadium - The moving parts in the football stadium are the players on the field. On the surface of the Earth, there tends to be much less motion at a football game because things aren't moving like in the stadium. In a car show, vehicles are moving. At an opera, there are instruments and singing that makes the performance moving. At a movie, there are actors that are moving on screen. - The only one that is really "not moving" is the stadium but there is motion from people moving.<n><n>Choice B: surface of earth - The surface of the Earth is the main area that things are moving: earthquakes, tectonic plates, tornadoes, weather, etc. That is not to say there isn't motion underground or under the ocean, and there is certainly motion inside man-made machines. - This seems to be the right answer.<n><n>### Input 14: How would you write a statement to indicate the addition of 5, 7, and 2?<n>Answer: There are a lot of ways to do this. One would be to write, 2+5+7 = 14<n>### Input: In this lesson we will learn about the different number operations that can be done. Which operation is taking a larger number and shrinking it?<n><n>### Response 7: Which operation is taking a bigger number and shrinking it down?<n>Option 1: Subtraction<n>Option 2: Multiplication<n>Option 3: Division<n>Option 4: Addition<n>Option 5: None of these<n>Answer: This operation is known as subtraction. It can be viewed as a combination of division and addition. In subtraction, you take away a smaller number from a larger number but you do not do any other operations on it.<n>### Input: There are many different operations that you can use with different operations. Choose the statement that does the same operation with multiplication as subtraction.<n><n>### Response Option 1: 9 X 16<n>Option 2: 2 X 8<n>Option 3: 3 X 12<n>Option 4: 2 X 4<n>Option 5: 8 X 9<n>Answer: 9 X 4 = 36 and 2 X 6 =12<n><n>### Inputs: There are

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny.
