Choices:  A: cross street B: milk cow C: lose weight D: step forward E: need food<n><n>### Response:		<n>E: need food<n><n>E: need food. E (The fifth letter of the English alphabet.) It (It's.)<n><n>E: need, food. E (The eighth letter of the English alphabet. The eight-letter word can, as noted by Shakespeare, be both the longest and the shortest in the language: "The shortest words in order I see and the longest are there for me. [The "longest" and "shortest" words are "longest," because the last four letters spell "long," and "short," a pair of words that sum is 56.] See [the page about Shakespeare's works](https://leetcode.com/explore/shakespeare/class/shakespeare-test-case/sh-72450/p/114698/) for more details.)<n><n>E:ne,food. You have 100 points earned for this answer.<n><n>### Input and response example<n><n>Input: I need a bicycle.<n><n>Response: Need, a, bike. Need (the first two letters of the English alphabet); a (the first letter of the English alphabet); bike (the sixth letter of the English alphabet)<n>

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? Choices:  A: get to know B: gain knowledge C: intelligence D: education E: gaining knowledge<n><n>### Response:		Answer: A<n><n>### Input::Learning usually leads what? Choices: A: to gain knowledge B: to get to know C: to greater education D: to gaining intelligence E: get known to<n><n>### Response:: Answer: C<n><n>### Input:-112°C is what term? Choices:A: A: Centigrade Celcius B: Celcius B: Centigrade C: Fahrenheit D: Kelvin E: none Fahrenheit F: Kelvin<n><n>### Response:-112° Celcius<n><n>### Input= How many points does Jovita received for passing Biology? Answer: 72 (she passed, with a C)<n><n>### Response= 0<n><n>### Input = What will happen if you multiply 4 by 7?  Answer: 28<n><n>### Response = 28<n><n>

Choices:  A: very heavy B: video game C: news article D: card game E: lead pencil<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input : 5+2=3<n><n>### Response : 7<n><n>### Input<n>```input:2=5<n>answer:5<n>```<n>### Input<n>A. What is the answer to 4x=?<n>B. What is the answer for 3÷?<n><n>### Response<n>A. 2<n>B. 1<n><n>### Instructions: <n>Bill is on vacation and wants to know the exact location of his hotel. How many times larger is 5°N latitude than longitude?<n><n>### Demostration : <n>Bill's latitude is 5°, and his longitude is 115°. 5° is exactly 20 times larger in latitude than longitude, because for every degree of latitude there are exactly 20 degrees of longitude.<n><n>### Answer<n>5° latitude is 2,500 kilometers north of the equator, and 90° longitude measures 20° south of the equator. Because 20° of longitude measure 2,501 kilometers each, the difference in latitude has the same difference of longitude.<n><n><n><n><n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:What is the biggest speech in the capital? Choices:  A: zoo B: museum C: hospital D: desk E: opera<n><n>### Response:		Choice that is correct is: C = hospital. <n><n>### Explanation: A zoo would not have zebras. Therefore, I would assume going to a zoo for a zebra would not be correct. I am going to go with something that would have zebras. A zoo would have zebras therefore not this place. A desk would not have zebra’s so go with C.<n><n>

Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>You can find it in space.<n><n>### Discussion:<n>1.  How does the writer/programmer use the command to get the answer?<n>2.  Is the command used before using the answer?<n>3.  What would happen if the student doesn’t use the correct answer?<n><n>### Input<n>```xml<n><question><n>  <command><n>    <argument> 1<n>    <argument> x<n>    <argument>y<n>    <answer>{<n>    <choice>A<n>    <choice>B<n>    <choice>C<n>    <choice>D<n>    <choice>E<n>  </question><n></text><n>```<n><n>### Response<n>This is a good practice.<n><n>### Input :<n>How long have you been in the Army?<n><n>### Answer :<n>I just joined 3 months ago.<n><n>### Output Example :<n><n>```shell<n>$ bash -c 'echo How long have you been in army?; select <y n> ; echo: '<n><n>1. How long have you been an Army?<n><n><y/n><n><n>y<n><n>$ echo How long have you been the Army?<n><n>How long have you joined the army?<n>```<n><n>## Challenge<n>> We would like to challenge you to make a script.<n><n>### Task :<n>Write the script and run 12 lines of code with a script name that does the operation below then answer the following multiple choice question based on the script.<n><n>## Solution 1<n>Run the script below and answer the following multiple choice questions: How many pints of Coffee does Genevieve drink? How much does Leila earns per week?<n><n>```shell<n>#!/bin/sh<n><n>coffee = 4.5<n>num_of_thermos = 18<n>num_of_tshirt = 9<n>num_of_jackets = 4<n><n>pint= 500<n>genevieve_coffee = (4.5/18)*1.2*1.2<n><n>genevieve= ((coffee/pint)*100)*2*8-5<n><n>leila_per_week = (${pint*9/num_of_t})*5<n><n>#echo $

If you had a 1 digit number in one of these tiles, you wouldn't be able to place a 10-digit number on the 10 × 4 puzzle.<n><n>### RES: 226, that's 2 six digit numbers.<n>

An ice cube is a tool that is able to provide moisture.<n>### Different Words<n>ice cube, surface of earth, dry, water, air, humidifier, moisture, cool, tool, earth

I'm getting a low confidence value because of the 52 people surveyed said that they were pleased with their financial outlook. <n><n>### Demostration:This question is meant to be a little bit more challenging. If your answer has a confidence score lower than 86, you should work to increase your confidence score with more reasoning and justification.<n><n>### Data:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>The information collected does not indicate a clear picture to show what proportion of people are satisfied with their financial outcomes.<n><n>### Results:<n>- The margin of error is 3.1%, and the p-value is <0.001.<n>- The confidence score is 56%.<n>- This means that there is confidence in the number of 496 (the number of dissatisfied individuals) and a lowering of confidence in the number of satisfied individuals. Based on these results, if you were a business representative looking to open a new store, it would be best to take on this task in an area with a large number of satisfied individuals. <n><n>## <n><n>

Choices:  A: college dorm B: back pack C: class room D: backpack E: office supply store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Explanation:** A classroom. B is wrong since backpacks only hold backpacks, but binders can be put in backpacks. C is wrong since backpack is a type and binders are a place. D is wrong since backpack was already mentioned and binders can be put into backpacks. E is wrong since office supply store is an adjective describing binder stores. Hence A is correct and a binder can be bought at college dorm.<n><n>### Input :A: The sun rises in the east.B: The sun rises over the horizon. C: The sun never sets.D: The Earth rotates away from the sun.E: The only reason the sun is visible is because light bends around the Earth.<n>F: The Earth travels at 1,040 miles per hour.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>**Explanations:** B: Sun rises over the ocean at dawn. D: Sun's rays are blocked by the Earth. E: Light bends as it reaches our eyes. F: Speed of the Sun only applies to star ship travel.<n><n>### Below is an instruction that asks you to write multiple choice questions.<n><n>### <n>Explanation 1: <n>- The word **each** could be removed in choices A, C, and E. <n>- Choices B and D don't have wording that means anything.<n><n>Explanation 2: <n>- The only answer that's grammatically correct is E.<n>

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:The competition was to see who would be the last one the drop the object, the hard part was you had to have your arm extended straight out while what the object? If the total number of points is even, the second player rolls the dice and adds the two numbers. If the total is odd, the first player rolls twice more. Whoever rolls 9 rolls should be the last player. If the players have more than 9 points after someone rolls 9, the next player who rolls a 1 should be the next player. If it's a tie, the game is over. <n><n>The task is that two people will randomly take turns rolling the dice and whoever get two, four, six, eight is eliminated. whoever get two will get a point. It will continue in the same way until two, four, six. whoever gets eight will also get a point. How many letters are there in the sentence?<n>![](images/screenshot2.png)<n>![](images/letter.png)**15 letters are given.**<n><n>### **Explanation** : The example has 4 letters because it's in a sentence.<n>

How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Where do you put your grapes just before checking out? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		<n>If your answer is E, then I respect that. I'm sorry it happened.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>A:<n><n>- Grapes on your grocery cart- $2.00 for 6<n>- Apples on the cashier's desk (on sale, $0.79 for 6)<n>- Avr. $3<n><n>B:<n><n>- Gone to the super market<n>- Grapes in your fruit basket on your fruit stand on your grocery cashier's table- $20<n>- Gone to super market - $3.00 for 2<n>- Bought 5 other items including apples and a chicken<n>- Total money spent - $39<n><n>C:<n><n>- Grafted all fruit and veggies and bought other items with other fruit and veggies as payments<n>- Grapes and Apples on my fruit stand and groceries cart<n>- Total money spent is at $37.<n><n>D:<n><n>- The fruit basket is placed just behind the baskets<n>- The cashier puts their phone away<n>- It is Sunday, so my fruit basket might be placed there<n><n>E:<n><n>- There are too many grapes for me and all my fruit baskets might fall off!<n><n>### What could go wrong with you if you go into the fruit market?<n><n>### What should you do when there is only 1 fruit basket in the fruit market?<n>- Do not put your grapes anywhere on the checkout to get a basket (as grapes can be heavy and cause problems).<n><n>### Input<n>In a hotel, there are 18 rooms. So will addition and multiplication.<n>Input 8:  We have to subtract 5 to get every number less than 20 to be divisible by 5.<n><n>Outputs: The answer for I will always be "odd." In the other cases there will be an output depending on which input you get.<n><n>### Response 1) What are the possible inputs?<n><n>The possible inputs for input 1 are all pairs of even numbers that are less than 1,000 and a multiple of 1.<n><n>---<n><n>The possible inputs to input #2 are all pairs of odd numbers that are less than or equal to one-half of 1,001.<n><n>--- <n><n>The possible inputs of input 3 are even numbers less than 1, 000 as well as multiples of 2, and pairs of two less than one-fourth of 1,020<n><n>---<n><n>For input 4, the possible inputs are<n><n>---

Choices:  A: income tax B: satisfaction C: sorrow D: ocean E: bill collectors to happy<n><n>### Response:		<n>C  <n>### In your own words, explain how you came to your answer:<n><n>### Test Your Skills<n><n>Select the best answer. Be sure to show how you arrived at the correct answer.<n><n>Which equation can be used to multiply fractions? 5(3x/4)+7=<n>A. 46/17<n>B. 113/20<n>C. 53/40<n>D. 112/19<n><n>Which of the terms in the following equations is a _?<n>5(3x/7)+7=<n>A, 46/19, 5, 1<n>B, 1, 9.<n><n>### Inputs For the game "H.O.R.S.E"<n><n>### Game play<n><n>### Input<n>Maria has 1 dollar and a quarter. If she doubles her money, she has an even amount of money. She gives the quarter away. How much money does Maria have?<n><n>### Response<n>C<n>### In your answer, explain how you arrived at your answer.<n><n>### Test your Skills<n><n>### Which of the following fractions is smallest?<n><n>8(3x)/11=<n>A. 1/2 <n>B. 3/8<n>C. 7/8<n>D. 4/7<n><n>### Answers for the game of "H.O. R.S.E."<n><n>Maria is a player, she has 8 quarter. She gives the first quarter 8(3x)/29(9-1)=4/9 Maria is now down 1 quarter. She gives her next quarter away, the money is now 1. She then gives away 9/10 of that quarter, the next quarter is now 9/100 Maria is down another quarter, the next player chooses whether to shoot and miss or shoot and make. If the next player makes, then the player who is up will have one less quarter and he must give a quarter away. If the player who was up shoots and misses, then he can choose to play or not to play until he makes a shot or misses 10 times. The player who was down does not have to give away a quarter.<n><n>### Skills Test

He then turned left 0.5 miles south on 6th street, 500 feet west on Oakland street. How many blocks is the bicyclist away from Oakland street? Choices : 2 blocks 3 blocks 4 blocks 5 blocks A block<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Instructions :<n>Input: Two sides of a parallelogram add up to 90 degrees. The product of the lengths of two sides is 34. There is only one way to solve this equation.<n><n>### Response- I can use the Pythagorean Theorem to solve this equation. I multiply the first two sides of the equation since there is only one side. The sides I multiply can be called X and Y. The X and Y sides are 90 degrees each because they are the sides of a parallegram. The squares of the X and Y sides are then 81 and 5. 52 =25 and 81 squared = 6881. 25*81=2025. Add 1 to 2025. That equals to 2026, 2026 squared is 414,976. The formula for the length of the diagonal is the square root of (base) squared + (height squared). So I have to take the square root of 414976. I can solve that with a calculator. It is 66.302<n><n>### Insturctions :<n>Input: There are five students in a classroom. 35% of their combined homework grade is 80 or greater. If Alannah averages 87, how many homework grades does she get out

Note this function does not utilize looping.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```javascript<n>  function calculateAvg(arr){<n>    let sum = 0;<n>    for(let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++){<n>      sum += arr[i];<n>    }<n>    return sum;<n>  }<n>```<n><n>## Solution: (Rejected)<n><n>> Write a function that accepts a number and returns a function. This returned function calls the original function with the passed parameters and returns itself. To do this, write code that:<n><n>> - Takes a parameter x<n>> - Calls the passed function twice, once on x and once on x * 2<n>> - Passes the returned values of those calls to the second arguments of the called functions and returns itself<n><n>`const functionOne = (x) => functionTwo(functionOne(x));`<n><n>## Solution: 05<n><n>> Write a recursive function that accepts a string, and splits it into its different lowercase letters and uppercase letters. Use two recursive functions, one to split the string into lowercase letters and one to split the string of lowercase into upper letters, and pass the letters to the first function you call.<n><n>`const getLetters = (word) =>  functionArray(mapLower)(list)(getLetters[word]("Low" + word))`<n><n>## Solution: **05** <n><n>> **The problem is in** the second line of `functionArray` and `functionMap`<n><n>````javascript<n>return getLetters([word[i]]);<n>````<n><n>> **The solution is**<n><n>````javascript **<n>return getLetters(word[i]);<n>````<n><n>## Solution:

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? How much can you afford?<n><n>***Output 2nd Row*** The total cost is $42.<n><n>***Input third row*** You need to pick your friend up in 20 minutes, but you need to get gas before you can start your car. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. A roadblock<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Instuctions:The city of Toronto needs a new city council. The city offers a position to candidates and they must hold a council meeting to decide how many chairs to buy. The candidates hold many meetings together. During these meetings, the candidates all agree that the meeting will have more chairs than the candidates who were absent. These candidates are called absentee. The remainder of the candidates are called present. Which candidates are absent and which candidates are present?<n><n>### Choices [Explanation]:<n>[ Explanation_1]<n>### Instruction : Input: Which numbers are the next two  prime numbers?<n><n>### Response : Prime numbers are<n><br> 2, 3, 5, 7, 11 <n><br> 13, 17, 29 <n><br> but not 1, 2, 4, 6, 8,9, 10, 12, 14,15,16, 18, 19 .<n>A prime number is 1. ( 0 is not a prime number)<n><br> So, 19 is not a prime number<n><br> <n><n>### Instructuion: Input : Anita has 5 pairs of shoes on her feet. 1/6 of the pairs weigh the same. Anita puts 1/8 of the pair in the wash machine. What pair does Anita leave on her feet?<n><n>### Explanation : <n>One pair weighs 1kg ( 1/6 of 10kgs)<n>so weight of 10 pairs are : 10kgs<n><br> 5/10 of 10kags = 5kgs<n><br>(5/6 of 5kgs) = 1kg<n><br> so one pair is : 5kgs, because it weights ( 5/6 of 1kg)<n>so, Anita still has 4 pairs<n><br> And 1/8th of 1kg is : 125 gms<n><br> so she has 7 paired and 1 pair

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:What does a virus primarily do to a person? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		<n>a<n><n>### Solution:<n>Answer:<n>```java<n>public class Solution {<n>   public static void main(String[] args) {<n>      Solution answer = new Solution();<n>     System.out.println(answer.solve());<n>   }<n>  <n>    public String solve() {<n>       Scanner scn = new Scanner(System.in);<n>   <n>       String inp = scn.nextLine();<n>       int input = Integer.parseInt(inp);<n>       System.out.println();<n>       return "This is a test case I have generated to complete my task successfully.";<n>   <n>    }<n>}<n>```

(Note: You should find and write into the blank the correct expression to calculate the answer. For example, in Row 2, the instruction is "You will find the answer in the other column." Choices:  A: being happy B: glee C: smoke D: stress relief E: may laugh<n><n>### Response:		<n>Whenever people are happy in life. They are called happy, they express it through smiles, laughter and even by saying happy. So I think that when we are happy, it means that we are in a situation that brings us joy. We can be happy at different situations in our lives. Whenever we are stressed or sad, we have different things to do as a way to reduce the sadness and improve our mood. We can do different things: 1. Talk to people we are close to, including family. 2. Listen to music that makes us feel happy that motivates us and brings joy in our life. 3. Do yoga, exercise, meditate, and other things to reduce the anxiety and calm down our minds. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option A, B, C, D<n><n>### Instructions:How did the Supreme Court interpret the Equal Protection Clause in Marbury v. Madison?.<n><n>### Response<n>The Court interprets the Equal Protection clause to mean that states and federal government cannot deny a particular individual a benefit on the basis of their membership in a group, such as a racial or ethic group. The Equal Protection clause only applies to discrimination by the federal government.<n><n>### Input<n>The case was called McDonell v. Stanton and was an appeal of a lower court case, Brown v. Board of Education.<n><n>### Response What decision did the Court make in this case?.<n><n>### Option A:<n>The Court ruled that racial segregation in public schools was unconstitutional because it violated the Equal Protection provision of the 14th Amendment. The Court found that segregation was a racial classification that resulted in different treatment of different races. The Court also found that the Constitution requires a substantial government interest before the government may classify individuals into different groups. The Court ruled that segregation was not necessary to serve any legitimate interest of the state in educating children in public schools.<n><n>### Option B:<n>The Court ruled McCollum v. Board of Education in favor of McCollum, denying the Board of Education the right to force school children to pray in the schoolroom. The Court found that the Illinois statute which permitted the use of school time and school property for religious instruction violated the establishment and free exercise clauses of the 1st Amendment.<n><n>### Question<n>What 2 important Supreme Court cases decided that unconstitutional racial segregation and inequality are pervasive in the country, thus making a comprehensive decision necessary to protect the rights of all Americans to equality?.<n><n>### Two important Supreme Court cases decided:14th Amendmenrt (which incorporated all of the Bill of Rights as well):13th Amendment (which emancipated black men)<n><n>### Which amendment to the Constitution was originally included to ensure the freed black slaves were not treated unequally with white citizens?.<n><n>Option A:<n><n>### Other amendments that specifically protect groups:Equality was not the primary purpose of the am

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? She lived an ordinary life with her family. She liked to read books, go to church, hang out with her friends and play video games with her sister. She felt that everything was going fine and that she had a great life, but she got a surprise when she went to play a very scary video game in the evening.<n><n>In the dark room, Tanya started playing the game. It was a scary game where you take control of a monster and scare people. Tanya got to play as the monster. She went out and found a man on a bench and scared him. Tanya jumped in a bush and peeked out to see if she scared the man enough. Tanya noticed the man had something in his hand. He was holding a cross and holding it close to his chest. That made Tanya very angry. She ran at the man and bit him on the neck. That made Tanya laugh, because she saw the man collapse and die instantly.<n><n>Tanya laughed with joy and started to do a happy dance. She suddenly realized she had been laughing so hard she forgot she needed to sleep. It was late, and she had nothing to eat. If she didn’t eat now, she wouldn’t have enough energy to wake up the next day.<n><n>Tanya had a hamburger and walked over to her bed. She felt tired. As she slept, her sister walked up to her room on the third floor and went in to see if Tanya was awake. Her sister found her body on the floor in the living room. Tanya’s family cried because Tanya died that night.<n><n>### Output:<n>Write a response or explanation using your own words, explaining the output.<n><n>### Analysis:<n>### Tips:<n>### Notes:<n>### Explanation:<n>

Choices:  A: drill B: learn C: require obedience D: understand E: spoon<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. A<n>2. B<n>3. C<n>4. D<n>5. E<n><n>### Instructions:Follow the directions to correct the sentence.<n><n>### Directions:Correct the errors in the following sentences and rewrite each sentence.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Use each of the bolded words in a sentence. Write a response that incorporates all of the words appropriately.<n><n>### 1.I've never seen a book with a _______ that's not a best seller. In fact, few non-fiction books ever make it to the top of the New York Times Best Sellers list even though their content may be more fascinating than your typical chick-lit novel.<n><n>### Response<n>I've never seen any book with a "blank" that's not a "blank". In fact, few "blank" don't even make it to the top-of-the-best-sellers list even though their book content is more fascinating than chick-lit novels.<n><n>### Note the following:There will be no spaces after punctuation marks unless needed.<n><n>### The above example demonstrates that the words "that's" and "list" are placed on either side of the sentence's only blank.<n><n>### Explanation of the process:<n>When a sentence has a blank where only one word belongs, the blank needs to be separated from the rest of the sentence with the word "that's" or "with" or "without." It's not so much about picking a word to go in the blank as it is about picking a word that appropriately identifies the type of sentence.<n><n>For other blanks in the sentence, it may actually help you to eliminate the word as a candidate. If the word doesn't go in a blank, you might not even notice that it wasn't the right choice.<n>

Choices:  A: inside the book B: oral report C: library D: fileing cabnet E: card catalogue<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n><n>Input: 2x<br>3x<br>4x<br>5x<br>6x<br>8x<br>14x<br>22x<br>23x<br>27x<br>44x. <br>What number should replace the line X in the following number sequence: <br>44441<n><n>### Response  <br>23<n><n>### Deduction:<n>``` <n>x^3 - 4x^2 -3x = 10.<n><n>1. Let x=1<n><n>x^3 -4x^3 - (1 - 3)^2  = -2 (we removed the x^2 by using 1 for x)<n><n> 3 +(2x^2+x-2) -1 = 10<n><n> 5(x^2+x) - 10  = 10<n>```<n><n>### The solution to the problem is:<n>``` <n><n>x= 5 (not 500)<n>```<n><n>## Sample Deduction Output:<n>```<n>Input:  x2 + 5x + 9 = 20<n><n>Deduction:<n><n>x2 + 5x = 9 <br><n><n>x = 5 (Not 500) <br><n><n>2x2 + 5 (the 5 is multiplied by 2) <br><n>```<n><n><n>### Sample Output:<n>```<n>x = 12 <n>3x = 36 <n>4x = 47 <n>```<n><n># Problem 1:<n>Problem:<n><n>>You and a friend divide the same quantity of candy into cones. Which cones do you each get more candy?<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>The friend will get more candy than you will because you have to give away 1 cup of candy.<n><n>### Solution<n>``` <n><n>Input: You and your friend split a large ice cube into four equal pieces. You need to type your response on the correct line<n>within the prompt.<n><n>### Text:<n>The task will test your ability to work with basic addition and subtraction,<n><n>and then your answer will be compared to the answer provided for the task.<n><n><n>### Response text:<n><n>1. How many letters would be at the post office if two people stole 100<n>from the front door and two people stole 250 from the front door.<n><n>A total of 350 letters would be at the mail box.<n><n>### 2. In a classroom, blue chairs, green<n>chairs, and white chips were present,<n>and there were 10 blue chips.<n><n>The green chairs were three times as many as the<n>blue chairs, and there were 13 fewer white<n>than the green and blue chips altogether.<n><n>How many chairs would be there in the classroom?<n><n>Green chairs have 3 times as many chairs as blue chair = 3x<n><n>Number of white chip = 13 -3x +10<n><n>White chip has 13 more chairs than green chip has = 3x + 13<n><n>Number of chairs = 3x+ 13/7<n><n>Number of chips = 40 - 3x =14/7<n><n>Total number of chairs = 40<n><n>## 3. He paid 25 cents for the pencil. How much Jericho paid?<n>- Jericho pays $1.50 for the pencil<n><n>### Response <n>### Input- A car drove 80 miles in the south, then went 40 miles in the north. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Shane was supposed to speak at his fathers funeral.  He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A.C.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Answer A: Shane acted very ridiculous, and this cheerfulness turned off the people who expected the funfare to be solemn.<n>Answer B: Shane acted very cheerful at the funfare, and this turned off the people who wanted to be serious.<n>Answer D: Not correct, Shane acted ridiculous, cheerful, and happy at the funfare, there are also others options for the answer<n>Answer E: Not Correct, <n><n><n>### Input : Janet has 9 more cards than Brenda. Martha has twice as many cards than Janet.<n>Input: Brenda has 9 more cards as Janet. Mara has twice more cards than Janet. How many people do they all together?<n><n>Input: Brenda lost 8 more cards than Janet, Brenda lost 5 cards than Mara, Brenda has 5 cards more than Mara, Janet has twice as many cards more than Brenda, Brenda 𝐼𝓂𝓂🝒𝓈𝓂𠵈𝕋ℎ 9 cards as Janet, Brenda has twice ��������������������������� more cards than Janet and twice as many cards as Mara. How many cards do all of them have altogether?<n><n>Input: (2x + 5)(3x - 9)<n><n>Answer: 275+3(5)(-9) => 1872<n><n>### Input  : Brenda's cards, is the largest one.<n><n>Input: Brendas, has more than Janet and Mara, cards together. Brenda has twice the number of Mara has. Janet has 9 fewer cards than Brenda. The larger of Brenda's two cards is the smallest one among all the cards.<n><n>Input: Janet's, has more than Brenda and Mara, cards. Brenda, has fewer cards than Janet has, cards. Brenda does not have the two fewest cards. The larger of Brendas cards is the second smallest one, among all the cards. <n><n>Input: Janets cards, is the smallest

We had never gone on vacation before and it was a lot of fun<n><n>### Subtopic Sentence:<n>We spent two days there and the hotel was ____________ (very large, very big, good quality) _________ (close to any of interest, near any of interest, near to any of interest, nearby any of interest).<n><n>### Explanation of the answer:<n>* Our hotel was right beside the ____________ (very popular, good, popular, famous).<n><n>### Question:<n>* Where was it located?<n><n>## Instrucciones<n>* Marlen is taking a nap.<n><n>### The action:<n>* Marlen is sleeping.<n><n>### What is the purpose of this sentence?<n><n>She is showing off her new phone, Mara doesn’t have one.<n><n>### Who said it?<n><n>* Marlen does, she is asking a question.<n><n>## Instrución<n>* The sentence says:<n><n>* "I thought everyone already has a phone."<n><n>### Why does he say this?<n><n>He doesn't believe that his friend is really sleeping.<n><n>

Which of the following shows how a rectangle made of these measurements, with its short length placed at the left side of the dog? Choices: A: 2,4,3 B: 2,40,3 C: 2, 3, 40 D: 2,41,3<n><n>### Response<n>B<n><n>### Input Choices:<n>Input: A pile of sandy soil is 3 times as deep as it is wide. If the width is 4 ft. What is the depth in feet? Choices: 1 ft. 2 ft. 3 ft. 4 ft. 5 ft.<n><n>### Response 1,3<n><n>1:2<n><n>#1<n>In this chapter, we will learn how to use the less then, greater then, or equal to equal sign (<, >, >=). We will also be familiar with the following symbols that we will be using throughout this course.<n>### Variable<n>A variable is a symbol used to represent a quantity that is unknown. <n><n>### Integer<n>An integral represents all whole or natural numbers.<n>### Real<n>A real number is a number with any kind of a non-zero denominator.<n><n>### Function<n>A function is a relation that assigns each element of a set to exactly one element of another set.<n><n>### Relation<n>An associative relation, also called a many-to-many relation, is a mathematical relation involving two ordered sets that each contain exactly one element.<n><n>### Set<n>A set is an unordered collection of objects or events or a mathematical object.<n><n>### Natural Numbers<n>Natural numbers are whole numbers in a counting and a number line.<n><n>### Rational Numbers.<n>Rational numbers are numbers in the form of p/q, where p and q are integers and q does not equal zero.<n>### Irrational Number.<n>Irrational numbers are numbers that cannot be exactly expressed by a fraction p/q, where q is a natural number (not zero).<n>### Integer<n>Integers are positive or negative whole numbers, zero, and all numbers that can be named using the same place-value system used to name whole numbers.<n><n>###

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? What is one thing they might do? Choices:  A: talk too much B: teach children C: open boxes D: answering questions E: giving homework<n><n>### Response:		Answer E, giving homework<n><n>#### Input: The teachers wanted to get their classrooms together before the school year started.  They needed to get everything done _____. Choices: A: in a row B: as soon as possible C: the same day D: by midnight<n><n>#### Response: Answer A: in a row<n><n>#### Input: Darius' parents give him $21 on Thursday and $9 on Monday next week. They wanted Darius to save half the amount he had left for the week. Next week Darius had an amount of money that was _____ by Sunday. Choices: A  : 9/2 B  : 18/6 C  : 17/10 D  : 7/4 E  : 4/8<n><n>#### Response:Answer E: 4/8<n>* Darius's parents gave him $21 on weekdays, $9 on weekends.<n><n>So on Thursday = $21.00 + $9.00 (since it was a weekend) =$30.00<n>* Next week = Thursday + 3 days = Monday<n>On Monday = $21.+ $9.00<n>So on Monday = $30.00+ $9.0 = $39 <n><n>* On Friday then he had $9 left<n>* For the week, he was left with (2) $9 so he was left with $18<n><n>#### Input: Which expression is a multiplication expression? Choices: 2760, 2760 + 2760 -1, 27620.1, 27,60.1, 49045.89, 27.160.<n><n>#### Response: 27.1.60.<n>* 276,000 is a whole number so to convert it into a multiplication expression, we need to multiply it by 2.<n>* 2 * 7 * 6<n><n>* 100345 has decimals<n><n>#### Instruction:In the given equation, write the term or phrase that correctly completes the equation.<n><n>#### Demonstration:1 x 15 = 15.<n><n>#### Instruction:(a)

In each case, explain why you think the description is correct for your choice.<n><n>### Response to Question:<n><n>My boyfriend is a person that works in a factory for most likely 8 to 10 hours a day and is probably working hard at something in a production line if he is, so a bicycle is most likely the best gift for him as it's something he really could use to run errands or something of the like because it's a better investment when compared to just getting him a regular gift such as a scarf or a necklace or any other small gift that just wouldn't be able to get you nearly as much money as another bicycle.<n><n>I understand that this is slightly off of the question because the question was asking for something with the best re sale value, but we can take away the re sale value from this answer and apply it if he does sell the bicycle then he would be left with $900, but if he does keep it well then he would use it for at least 9 months in fact most likely 12 months because that's about how long the bicycle will last as he will be hard on it and use it for at least a year or more.<n><n>The next factor would be the bike is not like $10,000 though because that amount is absurd to spend on a bicycle like the

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:If a person is seeing new things, what do they most often feel? How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Choices:  A: pleasant thoughts B: overspending C: moving there D: staying there E: debt<n><n>### Response:		<n>    A: 1<n>    B: 2<n>    C: 3<n>    D: 4<n>    E: 5<n><n>### Input<n><n>>I live in Alaska. I used to hate it, but now I've grown to like it because it's beautiful.<n><n>### Response<n><n>>I agree.<n><n>### Input and Response:<n>>Snowboarding is awesome!<n>><n>>I hate snowboarding.<n><n>### Problem 1:<n><n>```r<n><n>    #Input:<n>        100<n><n>    #Program the output.<n>    output <- 100<n>    if (i == 0)<n>    {<n>        total <- 100 - (max(i))<n>        output <- total<n>        return(output)<n>    }<n><n>    if (j > i)<n>    {<n>            output<n>            if (14.7/i>1)<n>            {<n>            j <- i - 14.7<n>            if (j%in%[1,2,3] | j == 6 | j == 7)<n>            {<n>                total <- j<n>                return(total)<n>            }<n>            }<n>    }<n>    else {<n><n>        return(14.7 * i)<n>    }<n>```<n>### Exercises<n><n>> Exercise: 3.1<n><n>### Input-Response:<n><n>> Input: I like this hat.<n>> Response: Do you want to buy it?<n>    <n>> Input: I am afraid of this spider.<n>> Response: Me too.<n><n>#### Exercise:3.2<n><n>#### Instruction:<n><n>#### Input<n><n>>Input:  100 / 0 = 100<n><n>#### Response<n><n>>Response: 10<n><n>#### Exercises: 3.3<n><n>#### Instructions:<n><n>#### Input: 75 / 5 = 25<n><n>#### Response: 55 = 5 * 11<n>

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:James went to the best steakhouse outside of the South.  Where is James? Choices:  A: dairy farm B: texas C: building D: michigan E: florida<n><n>### Response:		<n>[James didn't say where he's from, but he did say he went to a steakhouse outside of where he's from. The steakhouse was not in the South. But where was it? The answer is: A. The steakhouse must be in another state. Where else could it be, besides the South? So, the steakhouse was in a state other than the South. And, James didn't say anything about his state. So, whereever that steakhouse is, that's where James is.]

The task may be a single word, a phrase, or a complete sentence.<n>These tasks need to be done in order to make sure the house is safe and clean to live in.<n><n><n>### Response<n>If D is chosen then a choice of 1 should be given the answer in a complete sentence.<n>If D, A, and C are chosen, then 2 should be given a choice of which choice would be given a . <n><n>If D, A or C are chosen as the answer then the options to pick from is:<n><n>- If a choice of D is chosen,  A should be given as the  choice.<n>  -  Choice 3: Pay merchants<n>  -  Choose 4: Mail orders<n>  -  C: Hunt<n>- If A is chosen then the option to select from is:<n><n>  -  Choices: 1: Demand satisfaction<n>  -  Choise 2: Spend Money<n>  -  Choisen A: Demand satisfaction<n>- If C is chosen then the options to select from are: <n><n>  -  B: Pay merchandisers<n>  -  Choosen: 3: mail orders<n>  -  D: spend merchandise <n><n><n>### Input <n><n>The input is a 100 word sentence that gives

Fill in the blanks to respond by completing the request.<n><n>    -----------Original text----------<n>    _____: Hey, what are you doing?<n>    ----------Responding text------<n>     *Hi, I'm (1) on the way to my (2) class.<n><n>    ------------------------<n><n><n>### Response to the following:How much do they lose if they buy it for ₹ 1 lakh?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>10  thousand rupees<n><n>### Instructors' Response<n><n>### Instrumentation<n>### Subject<n>Its the subject that refers to the specific person who made the reply<n><n>### Verb<n>Its the word that indicate the act that the subject did<n><n>### Noun<n>It indicates the person or thing to be acted upon<n><n><n><n>### Insturctor's Question:<n>When you travel to Pune, is there one word to explain the route you took?<n><n>

If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. Gallian. _Prealgebra: Mathematics for Everyday Life with Access Code._ Pearson, 2014.][1]<n><n># Submissions<n><n>### Submission 1<n><n>#### Reference<n>[1] Douglas T., McMillon; Dwayne L. (Dwa) Puckett; Joseph A. Galliang. (2014) Prealgebra Textbook. Pearson<n><n>[2] https://www.math.com/students/calculator_help/graph-ing/<n>#### Submission Question:<n><n>1. What is the best way to write and explain the math to someone in a way that they don't feel intimidated by it?<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>The best way to write mathematics is as you see it and as it comes to you. There is no "special" way to write mathematics. So you will see it here as it is written on the paper with no fancy mathematical formulas.<n><n>#### Submission Question 2<n><n><n>#### Answer<n>####<n>So when you look at the solution that has been given to you, it is important to understand what has been done, how it has been done and that you are in no way being lazy by asking for a solution.<n><n>[1]: http://www.math.ua.edu/~mamyk/text/m1/m110-p1/soln.html [2]: https://www.mathsisfun.com/algebra/inequalities.html<n><n># Homework 1<n><n>```<n>-10.5<5.15-0<8.9-0<4.9-160+4.3>282<n>```

Choices:  B: wedding party<n><n>### Instructions:<n>This is more than just a number problem!<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: If you start with 6431, you double the next two numbers, subtract the last 4 numbers and triple the remaining, and then add all the remaining. Which of the following words can you use to describe your result?<n><n>**Correct: Excited**<n><n>**Incorrect: Pissed off**<n><n>**In correct: Disappointed**<n><n>**In correction: Sad**<n><n>**In incorrect: Upset**<n><n>### Response<n><n>If you start with 6, 4, 3 and 1 and multiply the next two whole numbers...<n><n>What are your next steps?<n><n>### Answer<n>You could continue by finding the next pair of whole even numbers, then double it and subtract it and triple the remainder.<n><n>```text<n>6(2) = 12<n>4(2) = 8<n>3(2) = 6<n>1(2) = 2<n>```<n><n>```text<n>8 + 6 = 14<n>4(2) + 6 = 8<n>2(2) = 4<n>```<n><n>The total is 22, so it's excited!<n><n>### Instruct:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration<n>Input: You have 4 apples, and 4 oranges. You need 7. What's your next move?<n><n>Correct answer: Trade apples for oranges.<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>In this scenario, you have 8 items. You need at least one more item. You have two methods to get that item. Choose wisely!<n><n>Your first method: Go to another city where you can find a second item.<n><n>Your second method: Go to another store where you can find the extra item.<n><n>## Reponse<n>Which method do you choose?<n><n>### A: I will go to another city since I love to travel and explore new places.<n><n># 5<n><n>## Instruciton:<n><n>Answer the multiple-choice question below.<n><n>## Demostration: I

If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:John spent too much money buying products for his swollen testicles.  He did so because he was feeling what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: delight C: bankruptcy D: agony E: owning<n><n>### Response:		<n>Pleasure or delight<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Input (2):In the past six months, the number of students at the high school has increased by 5%. How many students are currently enrolled, assuming that 60% of the increase was freshmen entering the school?<n><n>### Response (2):<n>24% of the freshmen are new to the school. 60% of it is 24%<n><n>### Expanation (4):

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Three quarters of what are covered by the ocean? Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		<n>A)<n><n>### Conclusion<n>If you are wondering how I got the answer then check the answer on the bottom of the instruction.<n><n>### Additional Question:<n>Input: A bus that cost 24 times as much to rent can take 3 times as many people as  a bus that costs twice as much to rent. How many more people could ride a bus that costs 24 times as a much to rent?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: Lennon buys a hat and a shirt for 5 dollars. Later, she has 50% more money for a sweater. Now, if Lennon buys that sweater, and her original money is still 5 dollars, how much does the sweater cost?<n><n><n>```js<n>// Solution Below.<n>function multipleChoiceQuestion ( question ) {<n><n>  let solution = ''<n><n>  question.forEach( 	question => {<n><n>    if ( question[0] === 'D' ) {<n>			solution += `<n><n>You answered "${question[2]}".<n>`<n>      }else if ( question[0].toLowerCase() === 'none of these are correct' ) {<n>        return solution<n>      }<n>		} )<n><n>  return solution<n>}<n>```<n><n><n><n>> Note<n>This task was made by <a href="https://github.com/chrisg21">Cody Mielcarek</a>

Choices:  A. paintings B. canvases  C. crayon D. watercolor E. pallet<n><n>### Input:- She's a good painter<n><n>- She's very good at her ______ what.<n><n>### Answer: - She's very good with ____ what<n><n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that<n><n>### Inputs:<n>The old house is located in 1313 Mockingbird Lane. There are no more than 20 units made of this house style in this country. The house is being renovated. It has 2 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, there are old and new amenities like heating systems.The old bathroom is going to be demolished and there will be no tub. There are two kitchens, one for the older sister and one for the younger sister.<n><n>### Input 1: <n>We will be using the kitchen on the older side, there are many drawers in there.<n><n>### Output: <n>____ There are many ____ drawers in there. Choices: <n>-A: cabinets<n>-B: drawers<n>-C: shelves<n><n>Answer: <n>"There are ________ drawers in there."<n><n>---<n><n>---<n><n>### Input-2:<n>The old bathroom is too small for 3 people. There's no plumbing to install a tub.<n><n>---<n><n><n>### Input3:<n>The new bathroom will have a shower, not a tub which is old. We will also have a smaller bathtub.<n><n>---<n>##

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Wanting to avoid the cabbage spoiling, where did he put it? Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```c<n>        function A(B) {<n>            var C = A(B);<n>            return A(B);<n>        }<n>```<n><n>#### Input:Tell whether 5 is smaller than 14.<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>```python<n>        function main() {<n>            var y:number,z:"";<n>            y=15;<n>            z="yes"<n>            console.log(z);<n>        }<n>        main();<n>```<n><n>### Input - Task name (T1 or T2)<n><n>### Response - Answer<n><n>### Input answer (T1 or T 2)<n><n>## T 2<n>

The painter painted three rooms and put a fresh coat of paint on one hallway and the carpenter did the carpentry work in two rooms plus one other room he had done earlier and repaired one closet. The owner's home had eight rooms and a hallway in a 1940s two-story frame town house in Boca Raton, Florida. (For example, they are mixed in with other ingredients to make the fruit cocktail juice.)<n><n>### Instrument:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instrument: <n><n>Instructions:  <n>You must find 6 cards that are missing from the deck (each of which is different), without looking at the face of any card in the deck or at the deck itself. <n><n>Instrument: Fill in the blanks of this multiplication problem. Each letter in the answer to part one will be the multiplication factor of the corresponding letter in the word given in part two of the question.<n><n>Input:<n><n>| Part One (Missing Card)             | Part Two (Answer)                    |<n>| :----------------------------------- | :------------------------------------ |<n>|  E T L P Y N D O U   P M S V   N A Z A M   O M   E   O   D T T W C   F F X   O Y L   P S   T D E  |  O Y D Z R   F X E  |<n><n>Instrument: Write at least 20 complete sentences. You may assume that each example includes 1 word that appears in the word search, but you do not know which word this is.<n><n>Instrument: <n><n>```<n>1<n><n>2<n><n>3<n><n>4<n><n>5<n><n>6<n><n>7<n><n>8<n><n>9<n><n>10<n><n>11<n><n>12<n><n>13<n><n>14<n><n>15<n><n>16<n><n>17<n><n>18<n><n>19<n><n>20<n><n><n><n>```<n><n>Instrument: How many hours are in 7 days?<n><n>Instrument: A bag of red M&Ms contains 15 white M&Ms. A bag of green M&Ms contains the same number of peanut M&Ms. How many nut M&Ms are in a bag of either colour?<n><n>Instrument  <https://github.com/Akron/mole_claw>  <http://www.pbs

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:A person notices popcorn, cotton candy on the grass, where is he likely? Choices:  A: soccer game B: fairgrounds C: movie theatre D: countryside E: state park<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### The correct answer is "A: soccer game".<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>- Cotton candy can not be seen in the other categories of the choices.<n>- Popcorn can not be seen in soccer game since this is just a game where players eat peanuts.<n>- The statement can be applied if this is happening in fairgrand and state park.<n>- In the countryside, this is a common thing and not a special thing so there is no such statement needed. The movies are expensive so they would not eat this food there.<n><n>### If you were a manager/supervisor, how would you assess someone else's response?<n><n>### Assessment Criteria:<n><n>### 1: Did the statement contain appropriate numbers and symbols? - Yes: **x**<n><n>### 2: Was the work completed to the best of your ability? **x**<n><n><# if (data.answers.length) { #> {{ data.answers.map((answer) => answer.answer).toString().html() }} <# } #>

Choices:  A: university B: concert C: home D: terminal E: airport<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n><n>What has high security? Choices:<n><n>```<n>A: University<n>B: Concert<n>C: Home<n>D: Terminal<n>E: Airport<n>```<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>>A<n><n>### Output<n>```<n>Security, or the lack thereof, is one of the key points of university life today. As society becomes increasingly connected, universities of all types are forced to create security measures to prevent the leaking of sensitive information. For example, at many universities students are required to use their campus credentials to log in to their laptops. The university's security team monitors the data generated by those laptops and alerts students to possible security threats. Another common security measure is the two-factor authentication, which requires the users to provide not only their password but also something they know: like the answers to security questions, or a one-time PIN number.<n><n>### Output 2<n><n>#### University security:<n><n>```sql<n>CREATE TABLE user (id INT, pwd VARCHAR(30), email VARCHAR(50));<n>INSERT INTO user (id, pwd, email) VALUES (1, "12345", "user1@u.edu");<n>INSERT INTO user (pwd, email) VALUES ("cat", "cat@u.edu"); //password must be 6+ chars<n>INSERT INTO user (email, pwd) VALUES ("dog", "dog@u.edu"); <---- password incorrect<n>SELECT * from student where id=@row_id;<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n><n>```sql=<n>SELECT * FROM user where [email]='dog@u.edu' and pwd='dog@gmail.com'<n>```

Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> A<n><n>### Input<n><n>Damon and his wife have 86 children and 62 grandchildren.<n><n>How many great-grandchildren do they have?<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>We are given the number of grandsons and number of grandchildren, so we know how to use this equation: 86xgreatgrandchildren + 62xnumbergrandchildren + numbergreatgrandchildren = NumberGreatGrandChildren<n><n>### Output<n><n>86xgreat-grandchildren + 64xnumber-grandchildren = 86xgreater grandchild hens +64y number of grand children + number greater-grandchild = 86x4 +62(x5)+5<n><n>86x4+62x5+104=428+62+104=587

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? She just wants to spend 1/3 of that on the house.<n><n>$4800x1/3=1600.<n><n>1600/4=400<n>$400 is how much of her income she can use.<n><n>So, 1/3 of 400 is 133.<n><n>### 2/3 of $4,500= $3,200<n><n>### 133/3=44.34<n><n>### 44.34+400=444.34,44.34 is 1/3 of $400<n><n>## Question: The price of all apples changes from 2 1/3 apples for a dollar to a dollar and a half for each apple. Choices:  A: fridge B: limejuice C: square D: gym E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A: fridge.<n><n>![instructions](assets/images/instructions.png)<n><n>1. If the sentence starts with `Where can you get in...:` then use `you`.<n>1. If the word `shape` is present, you can say "gym" but if it is not then you should not.<n><n>### InputWhere can you get in... : Choices: 🍈 A bicycle B a refrigerator<n>1. `Bicycle` is an object and not a noun.<n>1. "Garage sale" has an `s` so "fridge" should have a `g`.<n>1. `a refrigerator` is not a complete sentence.<n><n>---<n>Copyright (c) 2021, Lydia, Aiden, Bubbles<n>### Instructions:Describe the type of information and the location of the information using phrases provided in the table below.<n><n>#### Phrase                               |                 Type                           |                 Location <n>-----------------------------------  |   ---------------------------- | ------------------------<n>```<n>**Dates and Times**                   |   noun<n>```<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n>Input: 368<n><n>Answer: January 4th, 2017<n><n>### Instrucitons:<n>Write a response that appropriately completess the request below.<n><n>### **Instructions:**How much tape do you need to go around the perimeter of a room that is 14 feet wide and 35 feet long?<n><n>### Demostration<n>If you buy a meter of tape, you won't be able to go all the way around the room because you are going to run out. The amount of tape you need depends on the width of each board (1 inch). You will be able add two boards (two feet).<n><n>```<n>Input: 12 ft wide 16 ft long<n><n>Output: 96 sq ft of tape<n>```<n>[Video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Cs4sMXhJyKDp6BsKLX7Z0ZBWWxM-GXKJ/

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Choices:  A: school children B: parents C: get money D: require to pay taxes E: take money<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* Choice: D<n>* Justfication:<n><n>### Instruciton:<n><n>Write an instruction that appropriately completes each request.<n><n>## Instruction:<n><n>1. Ask a group of questions about a topic.<n>2. Answer the questions given the topic.<n>3. Have your students respond by answering the questions.<n>4. If requested, ask students if the answers match their responses.<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>### Input<n><n>* The topic is 6th grade at Ridgewood school.<n>* Ask about how many students <n>* Ask about what they like.<n>* Ask if they have a favorite class.<n>* Ask whom they like most.<n>* Ask if there are any problems in class.<n>* Ask if some students have difficult in math.<n>* Ask why they like certain subjects better than others.<n><n>### Response<n><n>* Choice A<n>* Justification: there are many students to teach at Ridgewood school<n><n>### Instructoin<n><n>* Ask students to explain why they selected their answer.<n>* Ask students to justify a different answer choice.<n><n>## Instrucution:<n><n>Select all words given within a sentence that fit a defined part of speech:<n><n>Example: This is a great restaurant with amazing food. <n><n>## Demonstraction<n><n>### Instraction:<n>Select all words given here fit in the sentence:<n><n>The woman who loves the man and is not married to him is a: ________<n><n>### Response.<n><n>* Choice. ___ ___<n><n>### Instractions:<n><n>Have students guess a word that fits into an underscored part of speech.<n><n>## Demostration<n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>Write a request that requires explanation in an appropriate way.<n><n>## Instuction:<n>```<n>What I'm wondering about is, do you get paid to study for this?<n>```<n><n>## Demonstranction<n><n>### Response Example:<n><n>* Choices:<n>* Justification: <n><n>### Insttructions:<n><n>Have the students explain the reasoning behind selecting a certain answer, or write a new instruction.<n><n>## Demomstraction<n><n>## Instruction<n><n>## Instrucitons:<n><n>```<n>To add

Since 9*9 equals 9*9*9 and we would like to simplify 9*9*10, we can use the distributive property with a common factor to change the 10 to 9. 9*9*8 = 72, and 4*6=24, so 4*6=9*1, and we can simplify it to 9.|<n>|What is a nonverbal example of communication?|Facial expressions could be considered an example of a nonverbal communication since they don't require words.|<n>|What has no weight, a shape, and can hold another?|An hourglass may be an answer to the question.|<n>|Why may you have trouble getting out of snow?|Snow makes it harder for wheels to turn because it makes it harder for the wheels to turn.|<n>|What can be shown without saying a word?|Sign language|<n>|Why do people often have trouble sleeping the night after a holiday?|The anticipation has worn them out and they are exhausted, which may be why they have trouble sleeping.|<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>### Input:It was breakfast time.  Brad ordered eggs, toast, and something to drink. What might he drink? Choices:  A: coffee B: throw up C: food D: getting drunk E: wine<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### If A, C, or E is checked, answer: I don't know<n><n>#### If B is checked, answer:<n><n>Ask Brad to tell you more about what he did yesterday.<n><n>#### If D is checked, answer: That sounds like a great plan!<n><n>#### If C is checked, answer: Tell me more.<n><n>### Input : You can play the tune "La Bamba". You play a quarter note with the middle finger of your right hand on the first string where 9th fret. You play an eighth note with 3rd finger on the second string 2nd fret. You play a quarter note then an eighth note with your pinky finger on the first string where the 5th fret is. To complete the tune, play the following notes in the correct order:<n><n>| D E C C B D G C A D C C A |<n><n>Where is each note played?<n><n>| 1st string 9th fret, 1st string 8th fret | 1st string 5th fret, 2nd string 8th fract, 2nd string, 2nd fret |<n><n>### Response :<n><n>```<n>For each note written, ask for where it is played.<n>```
